sub_title: Founder | Social Entrepreneur (connect, create, and have fun)
summary:
Passionate and committed to an inclusive world that works for all, by creating and facilitating businesses and projects that improve the quality of life of people. 

1. Leadership:
> Founder of Carewithinreach B.V. and Profort S.A.S. : we decentralize & professionalize orthopedic care to those who need it most in Colombia with a scalable clinic formula. 
> Impact by June 2023: we brought mobility to over 1400 persons with a disability in 2 years time.
> A servant and accessible leadership style that encourages feedback, new ideas, fast decision making and ownership by team members.
> Excellent interpersonal & relation-building skills
> Proven ability to communicate with people and organizations of diverse backgrounds and skills because of emotional intelligence & empathy.

2. Fundraising skills (from investors and foundations):
> Proven track record: > 1.400.000 EUR

3. Program / business management skills
> Over 10 years proven experience in design, management, and implementation of international (entrepreneurial) projects.
> Successful coordination and facilitation of international consortia, (academical, non-profit and for-profit stakeholders)
> Financial management, strategic thinking & planning skills to manage projects, solve problems, and make informed decisions.
> I love to build a (company) brand from scratch, create visibility

Storytelling & language skills:
> I have written several articles on international development, covering topics such as poverty, social entrepreneurship, conflict, social and gender inequality, and environmental sustainability - focused on Latin-America.
> I am a polyglot: fluent in English, French and Spanish, Dutch, intermediate in German, and beginner in Portuguese and Arabic.

Keynote speaker, jury & guest lecturer:
> Guest lecturer e.g. Rijksuniversiteit Groningen, Radboud & Erasmus Rotterdam
> Jury member and frequent speaker on social international business

Awards:
> Named Alumna of the Year of 2016 by Groningen University in The Netherlands
> My project and business ideas won several entrepreneurial awards

projects.title: LegBank
projects.description:
Worldwide, 40 million people need orthopedic care but have limited or no access to it. Reasons are many, but the most important ones are that prosthetic care is worldwide highly centralized, local clinicians face several obstacles to start their own clinic and the current supply of prosthetic clinicians worldwide falls short by 40.000+

LegBank combines a social entrepreneurial strategy to decentralize and professionalize care to vulnerable rural communities, empowered by technology. We delivered:
•  an app that eases data collection, guides clinicians in treatment protocols, stores patient information safely and gives patients the opportunity to share their satisfaction
•  an orthopedic product, called the Majicast that creates a prosthetic socket in 5 minutes automatically. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B1r490s5bds

LegBank was initiated in June 2014 in order to bring orthopedic care right to those who need it most. We started in Colombia, where OCHA states 'a forgotten humanitarian crisis'; 17 million people live in areas of (post)conflict and it is highly affected by landmines. 

LegBank won several awards. Also, we received significant financial support from the Dutch government and Google.org.

contributors.headline: Founder | Social Entrepreneur (connect, create, and have fun)
Human Centered Design director at Proportion Global

projects.title: SuSuGa: Sustainable Schools Uganda
projects.description:
Worldwide there is a major problem providing access to quality education to all children of school-going age. One of the major problems is the lack of resources, which leads to insufficient educational performances.  ProPortion proposes a new sustainable model.

The main idea behind this model is that schools can become self-reliant through optimization of operational costs, and by securing own revenue streams through social entrepreneurial activities. With more financial stability, schools are empowered to fulfill their primary function to enable children to develop and realize their full potentials and aspirations, which are essential building blocks of a society.

In collaboration with two Ugandan Organisations (The Child is Innocent and Grassroots Innovation Uganda), we researched the local context in Uganda, where a big number of children in especially North and East Uganda do not have access to quality education.  We executed a baseline study, created a detailed stakeholder map, elaborated the concept, and prepared a feasibility study together.

contributors.headline: Founder | Social Entrepreneur (connect, create, and have fun)
Supporting SMEs with Digital Transformation | Odoo Gold Partner

projects.title: Sustainable Match
projects.description:
Sustainable Match is an initiative of six complementary parties: MVO Nederland, Agri-ProFocus, Oxfam Novib, People Connector, ProPortion and BBO.

SMEs can be both profitable as well as having a social impact, when matched to the right local partners in the right way. Sustainable Match developed an innovative approach to combine sustainability and matchmaking between small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in emerging economies and The Netherlands, and provides answers to questions such as 'how to improve private sector development instruments and policies, and how to better involve SMEs in emerging markets in developing countries to contribute to economic development and poverty reduction.

profile_positions.description:
Care Within Reach enables the professionalization and decentralization of orthopedic care, starting in Colombia. We do this through the creation of orthopedic care centers in regions that lack access to care. The centers are one-stop-shops for orthopedic care, offering a full range of orthopedic products and services. This way we create access to qualitative care, delivering mobility in the vicinity of people’s homes. One clinic treats over 7700 clients in 5 years. 

My role is to:
•	motivate team members through a shared vision to facilitate growth
•	build and nurture trust relationships with business partners 
•	push sales and our financial performance
•	act as public speaker and public relations representative
profile_positions.title: Founder, Managing Director

profile_positions.description: To write articles on the topic of social entrepreneurship and international development for the online platform of ViceVersa, a Dutch Journal on International Development.
profile_positions.title: Blogger & Journalist

profile_positions.description:
•	Successfully fundraised a DHI proposal to research business opportunities in West-Africa 
•	Created the annual report, ToC and marketing tools 
•       Identified potential clients in South America & Africa
profile_positions.title: New Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
•	Initiated an award-winning project to professionalize orthopedic care in Colombia (LegBank)
•	Delivered an app and a medical product (Majicast)
•	Managed an international consortium (engineers, health professionals, academics)
•	Fundraised €1.100.000 through google.org, subsidies and awards
•	Featured in over 40 interviews (radio, tv - NOS, RTL-Z) incl. brainstorm with Bill Gates.
•	Keynote speaker at conferences and guest lecturer at several universities in the Netherlands.

From 2011 - 2013:
• Consultancy services for NGOs applying a Human-Centered Design approach
• Co-developed matchmaking platform 'Sustainable Match' to create sustainable business matches leading to sustainable trade and inclusive business models.

profile_positions.title: Micro Finance - Junior credit analyst

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Co-facilitated a weekly workshop at TIGE: trust and integrity in the global economy, part of a larger summer-conference organised by Initiatives of Change. 
•	The workshop highlighted the nexus between traditional farming, and sustainable and innovative ways of generating energy, food production and fuel consumption.

• Building a community of conscious consumers for a sustainable lifestyle in a positive, accessible way, though fb & website with sustainable products, initiatives and a database of (web)shops 
• In charge of motivating volunteers, branding, and organization of events to connect consumers and social entrepreneurs.

company.name: IDleaks, now called "Expertise Centre Humanitarian Communication"

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Made the topic of International Development Cooperation accessible to a broader audience through workshops and articles 
•	Stimulated development organisations and media to communicate in a respectful and honest manner about their work and the people they support.
•	https://issuu.com/idleaks/docs

For the duration of 9 months:
•	Organized creative workshops, and wrote and directed a theatre play, with (former) drug addicted  street children and ex child soldiers, to push self-esteem and reflect on values and self empowerment
•	Fundraised for several orphanages with through a weekly blog in the newspaper Noord-Hollands Dagblad
